text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmittal reinstates 2.4.31, IDRS Terminal Input, Command Code LEVY.
Editorial changes were made to reﬂect the new year date of January 1, The addition of 2 address lines to the database has required a modiﬁcation to some of the displays.
IRM 2.4.31, dated December 2, 2011, is superseded.
Large Business and International (LB&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB/SE), Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE), Wage &Investment (W&I)
Chief Information Officer

) Purpose: This transmits revised IRM
, IDRS Terminal Responses, Command Code LEVY (
) Audience: All IRS business units. (
) Program Owner: Account Services (
) Primary Stake Holders: LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I (

) Program Goals: IDRS utilizes only the TIF for the storing of all levy sources. All levy sources can be individually researched (LEVYS) and/or deleted (LEVYD) during real-time. The levy source type can be determined by referring to the LEVY-LITERAL ﬁeld on the screen display.
DESCRIPTION OF SOURCE
Real-time levy sources can be researched (LEVYS), added/entered (LEVYE, LEVYM), deleted (LEVYD) or update/revised (LEVYR) during real-time.

Information Returns Master File levy sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time pro- cessing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

Employment Commission levy sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time processing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

Federal Tax Deposit levy sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time processing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

Electronic Filing levy sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. ELF sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised through real-time processing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

Remittance Processing System levy sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or address revised only through real-time processing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

Federal Contractor levy sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time processing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

Defense Manpower Data Center levy sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time pro- cessing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.
DESCRIPTION OF SOURCE

Defense Manpower Data Center Federal Employees (Civil Service) are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time processing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

Defense Manpower Data Center Federal Employees (Civil Service Retired) are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time processing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

USPS (United States Postal Service) Employees are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time pro- cessing. They cannot be entered or otherwise revised through real-time.

FPLP (Federal Payment Levy Program) sources are posted to the TIF through systemic levy processing. These sources can only be researched and/or deleted and/or the address revised only through real-time pro- cessing. They can not be entered or otherwise through real-time.
) This IRM and the contained subsections provide the user the necessary infor- mation on how to use Command Codes LEVYS, LEVYE, LEVYM, LEVYR, LEVYD
Command code LEVYS will display the TIF levy sources in priority order as
Command code ENMOD (See 2.3.15) may be used to see if levy source data is present on the TIF. The LEVY-SOURCE-INDICATOR will display “ LEVY SRCE PRESENT” otherwise nothing is noted on ENMOD.
Levy sources can be updated on the TIF at MCC (IMF) and TCC (BMF) only.

) Command code LEVYE is used to establish levy source information on IDRS for a particular Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number. If the levy source being added exceeds ﬁfteen, LEVYE will prioritize the sources currently on the TIF deleting the lowest priority and adding the higher priority. Each levy source entered must be unique. Command code LEVYE supports the use of the “tab” function. (

) Command code LEVYM is used to provide a screen used to establish three new levy sources on IDRS for a particular Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number at one input request. LEVYM will provide a screen with three blank real-time formats for levy source entries and a command code/deﬁner of LEVYE. Further processing is through LEVYE. (

) Command code LEVYR is used to revise levy source information on IDRS a particular Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number. The LEVY-SOURCE-NUMBER required as displayed by the LEVYS output screen. Command code LEVYR supports the use of the “tab” function. (
) Command code LEVYD is used to delete levy source information on IDRS a particular Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number. (
) Whenever command codes LEVYE, LEVYM LEVYR, or LEVYD are success- fully executed a ENT-ACTION-HIST-GROUP entry is generated showing command code, date, and employee number. IDRS/ACS: (
) Levy sources can be deleted from the TIF at MCC (IMF) AND TCC (BMF) (
) Eliminate duplicates —careful review of duplicates should be done to assure that these sources are in fact duplicates and not just different accounts at same location. (

) TIF levy sources that have the lowest priority should be deleted ﬁrst. Carefully review levy sources, if the correct money amount indicator (LEVY-FORM-CD on a RT source only) can be determined use command code LEVYR to revise levy source information on the IDRS RT source. Otherwise, use command code LEVYD to delete levy source information on IDRS. (
) IRMF levy sources should be deleted in order of priority, with CTR sources having the lowest priority. These are “IR” levy sources which are denoted by money amount indicator of

as a source amount and your source amount for wages is $
you may want to delete the Interest source rather than the Wage.) (

) The following are next in priority for deletion: • EF—Electronic Filing sources. • RT—Real-time Wage sources. • FR—DMDC Retired Federal Employees or • DM—Defense Manpower Data Center levy sources or • FE—DMDC Federal Employees levy sources or • PS—United States Postal Service Employees levy sources. • RP—Remittance Processing levy sources or • FT—Federal Tax Deposit levy sources. • EC—Employment Commission levy sources. • RT—Real-time Non-wage sources. ) VALID RESPONSE: If no errors are present, one of the following valid response messages will be displayed in inverse video on line
or line

all command codes except LEVYS. The following are valid response messages: a. REQUEST COMPLETED-RT LEVY SOURCE ADDED —This message appears when multiple levy sources are displayed on the screen and a successful real-time update has occurred. (LEVYE) b. REQUEST PROCESSED-LOWPRIORITY SOURCES DELETED —Data entered on the screen is valid. Sources that were lowest in priority were not added to the TIF. The TIF has been updated with the new informa- tion. (LEVYE) c. REQUEST PROCESSED-DUPLICATE ENTRIES DROPPED —Data entered on the screen is valid. Any duplicates were not posted to the The TIF has been updated with the new information. (LEVYE) d. REQUEST COMPLETED-LEVY SOURCE(S) REVISED —This message appears when multiple levy sources are displayed on the screen and a successful real-time levy source update has occurred. Screen will be blanked out. (LEVYR) e. REQUEST COMPLETED —This message appears when levy sources have been successfully deleted. (LEVYD) (
) INVALID RESPONSE: If any errors are present, one of the following error messages will be displayed in inverse video on line
or line

The are valid error messages: a. COMMAND CODE INVALID FOR AIMS —File source was input with value of “D”. b. COMMAND CODE INVALID FOR CAF —File source was input with a value of “R”. c. COMMAND CODE INVALID FOR EPMF —File source was input with value of “

COMMAND CODE INVALID FOR AIMS —File source was input with a value of “D”. COMMAND CODE INVALID FOR CAF —File source was input with a value of “R”. COMMAND CODE INVALID FOR EPMF —File source was input with a value of “

d. COMMAND CODE INVALID FOR NMF —File source was input with a value of “N”. e. INVALID TIN —TIN and ﬁle source did not meet standard validity criteria. Correct and re-enter. f. ACCOUNT NOT ON FILE —There is no information on the TIF for the TIN and ﬁle source input. g. NAME CONTROL MISMATCH WITH TIF—Name control does not match name control in the BASIC-ENT-REC on the TIF. Correct and re-enter. h. INVALID NAME CONTROL —Name control does not meet standard validity criteria. Correct and re-enter. i. NO CURRENT SOURCES ON THE TIF-INPUT SCREEN PROVIDED — Blank LEVYE screen will be provided. j. ?-UNRECOGNIZABLE TIF LEVY SOURCE —Money amount indicator and/or document type do not meet standard validity criteria. Delete source from IDRS with command code LEVYD, or correct source on IDRS with command code LEVYR. k. EMPLOYEE NUMBER nnnnnnnnnn INVALID —An attempt was made to access an account on the TIF with an employee number that is invalid. Correct and re-enter. l. EMPLOYEE nnnnnnnnnn NOT PROFILED FOR BTIF ACCESS —An attempt was made to access a BTIF account by an employee not proﬁled for BTIF access. m. EMPLOYEE nnnnnnnnnn NOT PROFILED FOR ITIF ACCESS —An attempt was made to access an ITIF account by an employee not proﬁled for ITIF access. n. EMPLOYEE nnnnnnnnnn PROFILED FOR RESEARCH ONLY —Employee may research TIF account. Employee denied access to LEVYD, LEVYE, and LEVYR. o. (Service center #

) IS THE CONTROLLING LOCATION FOR ACCOUNT- NOT (ALN ) —Levy sources can be updated on the TIF at MCC (IMF) and TCC (BMF) only. Employee at MCC is denied access to LEVYD, LEVYE, and LEVYR if account is on TIF at TCC. Do a remote access of the account at TCC using LEVYS.
) TIN MISMATCH WITH CSTT STORED DATA —TIN and ﬁle source did not match TIN and ﬁle source stored in the SIR from the previous command code. (
) INITIATE LEVYS —Command code LEVYS must be done prior to any other LEVY command code. Input the command code LEVYS and re-enter. (
) NUMBER LINE FORMAT ERROR —Incorrect format of source numbers on TIF. (
) SOURCE NUMBER MISSING —LEVY-SOURCE-NUMBER is not present or incorrect. (
) LEVY SOURCE NOT PRESENT ON TIF —Levy source is not present on the TIF. (
) DUPLICATE SOURCE NUMBERS ENTERED —The same levy source number appears more than once. Correct and re-enter. (
) INVALID SOURCE NUMBER —Levy source numbers not in valid range of

) ONLY RT LEVY SOURCES CAN BE ENTERED —An attempt to post a levy source to the TIF that is not a Real-time source has been made. (

through denoting the screen position of levy sources) are required on input to LEVYR for prioritization purposes. Re-evaluate and re-enter. (

) INITIATE LEVYS—Command code LEVYS must be done prior to any other LEVY command code. Input the command code LEVYS and re-enter. (
